body:
i have read in the last issues that there is a python way (yowsup) but I dont know how can i use it
can anybody help me how can I register with my own password and use the account from the pc pnly

I was uisng the .net whatsapi posted by @perezdidac and it was working fine for me but now it is showing succes and message is sent but i don't receive any message on my phone number

comment_data.body: @kingk110  https://github.com/tgalal/yowsup/wiki/yowsup-cli

I used this comand : 
python yowsup-cli --requestcode sms -c config.example
and get this error :
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "yowsup-cli", line 189, in <module>
    password = identity or password if args["v1"] else base64.b64decode(password)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/base64.py", line 76, in b64decode
    raise TypeError(msg)
TypeError: Incorrect padding

I don't know python well can u help?

I was using a long password.when i replaced the password with 1234, it worked and gave me sent but how much should i wait to receive the message.

is it using the same way the .net api uses? because it also says that message sent and i don't receive any message

Thanks I used the voice request it was faster than sms and it worked well and was able to send message.
i used the same password with the c# .net api but it is giving me wrong password do you have any idea about how can i use the password in that api because i need to send message from a console application of mine and not from python

I am even trying to register by calling the function `WhatsRegister.VerifyRegistration(countryCode, phoneNumber, tmpPassword, tmpCode);` using the code sent by the python yowsup but the server is replying with "failed-old-version"

I have succeeded to register new number and send sms from python. But when the number and hash used in php, in this very api, login fails (I removed the md5(strrev($imei)) part from encryptPassword, just used the hash). So does the php need an update?
can you explain how it worked with you because I am using the password of the python with the .net and it says wrong password
I just followed the instruction given here: https://github.com/tgalal/yowsup/wiki/yowsup-cli. But the password generated here is not supported in php (most probably it won't work in .net too)

same for the .net
we must find a solution but how ??

bigger problem!!!
now even the yowup is giving me "fail OLD VERSION" !!

@kingk110 update and try now, it's has just been fixed. 

about Yowsup password, the password which the server returns is base64 encoded. To use it you must decode it first.

whic api has been updated?
do u mean the .net api? or the yowsup ?
yowsup, I just updated it to fix "fail old version" issue

Ok thanks man
but i am using the decoded password in the .net api but still not working ?!
I don't know about that .net api I never tried it..
can u tell me how u solved the "fail old version" in the yowsup so i can try to do the same in the .net ?
You need to update the user agent it uses
decode base64 to what? ISO/UTF-8/UTF-16/ASCII? I think @kingk110 is facing an issue with that target format

I removed all encryption types of imei in the .net api and used the utf-8 encoded password of the yowsup but still getting  wrong password
can any .net developer help me plz what should i change to make it work ??
I never tried with .net API, A very crude solution could be embed your python function in .net
wo muss ich die seriennummer angeben damit ich auf einem whatsapp erlangen kann bzw sehen kann was der jenige geschrieben hat bzw selbst schicken kann?
@otto5050 - the security hole you are referring to is not present anymore. Every WA user now has a dedicated logon password which is sent to him on registering.

title: registering a new account with no need to use it from phone
